column4: how come when i type "su" and i type  my password, i dont get jack, but if i type Sudo <command> and enter the same password it works?
how come i cant change to root? is it disabled?
i know what sudo and su are, but why cant i just use su to stay as root in terminal?
read the link, root passwd is not set by default as a security precaution, ubuntu uses sudo instead
